alert.note: Alert for Brown; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 6:16AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Rock and northern Brown Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 615 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Springview to 13 miles north of Ainsworth to 7 miles west of Norden. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ainsworth, Bassett, Long Pine, Newport, Johnstown, Keller Park State Recreation Area, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Pony Lake, Pine Glen State Wildlife Refuge and Antelope Peak. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 169 and 206. Highway 20 between mile markers 226 and 273. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
